{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3164993,"name":"Smtopps","username":"Smtopps","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/smtopps/{size}/166758_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-15T03:08:41.164Z","cooked":"

We are integrating the limelight botpose into our pose estimator. We have had it working for awhile but not utilizing the vision measurements because of the reliability of the tracking. When we have 1 tag in view and at close range it tracks great. When 2 tags are in view at any distance it tracks great. When 1 tag is in view and far away it does not track good. If our pose estimator is tuned to trust the vision more then it gets jittery at points when we only see one tag. If we trust the vision less then it tends to be sluggish at updating the pose.

Additional question. How would we integrate a second limelight botpose into the pose estimator. Can we just add it as another vision measurement or would that mess with pose estimation.

Additional information:
camera height: 1.25m
camera pitch: -15deg

We are looking at moving the camera down 10in

You probably want to look at why your pose is bad when 1 tag is in view from far away. You should tune the Limelight pipeline settings to either get it tracking well, or filter it out.

Yes, you can incorporate a second limelight and just add additional vision measurements to the pose estimator. They will both use the same standard deviations.

If it helps here are the limelight settings we are currently using. It is the best we have gotten the tracking so far. I’m also updating the post to include the camera placement.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M2pM-ZuLGcsDOxmipd2xVr2g2pjIxElI/view?usp=sharing, https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M41KgKsFzO0RC2PdkbO-nl5N5psYvTw4/view?usp=sharing, https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M5OzDbebgCfxG4818tPC-DP0iWDtnZLj/view?usp=sharing, https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M7oJmtEgNG53EQcYuLxmp4Gj7VIgQBDd/view?usp=sharing
